reviews.review_msg: Engaging, and dedicated to teaching her students so that everyone gets the most out of her class.

The best. She has such a caring and bubbly attitude and truly cares about her students well-being. If you can take a course with Dr. Soma, take it!!! She even brought snacks to class.The content of 357 is so applicable and so important to all of our lives. Dr. Soma is an all-round great person and is so passionate about this course and the field.

TAKE HER CLASS! Tammara cares the most for her students! Took this as an elective to fill upper-division credits. The is content interesting and the assignments are fun (three 500-1000 word papers/assignments)! Her lectures are engaging, she is an expert, and is making our final exam optional to lighten students' workload.

Great prof, only complains is she engages with students a little too much and then has to rush through the rest of lecture. Then again students should know when to stop talking when there no time left. I also wish we had some group work to do. Super engaging and very friendly. You can tell she put a lot of thought into her assignments and lectures.

Tammara made the class enjoyable and easy. Her recorded lectures were interesting and she was enthusiastic in them. The assignments are easy and she extended the deadlines for them a few times. There were opportunities to get bonus marks. She really cares for her students and responded to emails quickly.

Tammara is the most caring instructor I have had at SFU! During her recorded lectures, you can notice her enthusiasm for the class and can truly tell that she loves teaching. She also looks at things from the students' perspective. That is why she has extended the deadline for assignments a few times and also given us an extra credit assignment!
